com.codecool.core

Class AppObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.core.AppObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bufferable, Renderable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Animation

    public abstract class AppObject
extends Object
implements Bufferable, Renderable
    It's represents an object in the app, which can be drawn in the terminal and updated in every frame.

    Mostly you have to override update() to implement a uniq behavior.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected App app
      A reference of the application host
      protected char[][] renderSymbols
      Characters that will be represent the object on the screen.
      protected String tagName
      It can be used to get AppObject(s) from the host by the App.getAppObject(s)ByTagName() It is not forced to be uniq.
      protected int xPos
      Determines the x position of the object.
      protected int yPos
      Determines the y position of the object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AppObject(int xPos, int yPos, char[][] renderSymbols, App app)
      Constructs an AppObject.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppObject

        public AppObject(int xPos,
                 int yPos,
                 char[][] renderSymbols,
                 App app)
        Constructs an AppObject.
        Parameters:
        xPos - x coordinate of the object in the app.
        yPos - y coordinate of the object in the app.
        renderSymbols - characters that will be drawn on the screen.
        app - a reference of the host.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        This is an important method. When you inherit from AppObject and you like to do some dynamic motion on the screen or do a calculation in every frame, this is the place to implement that. This method will be called in every frame by the host app.

      • getXPos

        public int getXPos()
        Returns:
        the x position of the object.
